memberdef.argsstring: (const char *server, uint16_t port, const char *clientName, const char *username, const char *password, int pwd_len, bool autocommit=true, bool use_compression=false, uint64_t sessionId=0)
memberdef.name: exasockets_connection

briefdescription.para: Establishes a connection to EXASOL and returns an exasockets_connection object.

parameterdescription.para: The IP address of the EXASOL node to connect to. E.g. '192.168.137.10'
The Port the EXASOL DB listens on. E.g. 8563
The name of the client, as it will be shown e.g. in the CLIENT column in EXA_(USER/ALL/DBA)_SESSIONS. E.g. the name of the frontend.
The EXASOL DB user name for authentification. E.g. 'sys'
The EXASOL user password. E.g. 'exasol'. Transfer is always RSA encrypted.
If the DBMS is supposed to execute a COMMIT automatically after each statement. Default: true (recommended)
If the result sets are to be transferred compressed. Default: false. Compression is not yet implemented on the client side.
An ID for the session to be created in EXASOL. Per default a random session ID is created (recommended).

simplesect.para: An exasockets_connection object containing an open connection.

briefdescription.para: Sends an SQL statement to EXASOL and fetches the response.

detaileddescription.para: Sends an SQL stmt and fetches the result set. If a result set handle is received instead of data, then this is returned as an int. Otherwise 0 is returned and the resultSet is stored inside the connection object.

parameterdescription.para: The SQL statement, e.g. 'select * from schema1.tbl1'

simplesect.para: A result handler to be used with fetch() if available, otherwise 0.
